title: Stranger Things season 4: Russian translation of The American reveals clue
text:
Stranger Things fans found another clue pointing to The American (Picture: Netflix)

Stranger Things 4 is coming, which means we’re inching a little bit closer to learning the identity of the American.

If it’s not Jim Hopper being held captive by the USSR then, honestly, we predict a riot. But fans have worked out another clue which can only fuel all hopes, as they translated the Russian guards’ murmurings and revealed The American is almost certainly a man.

So we can rule out Barb, a common theory among Redditors.

According to Russian fans of the trippy sci-fi drama, the soldiers used the male version of ‘American’ when whispering about their hostage. So who could it be? Hopper? Murray? Alexei? BILLY?

Only time can tell but thankfully we won’t have too long to wait as Netflix dropped the very first season four trailer earlier this month which can only mean a return to Hawkins is on the horizon.

As for what’s in store, don’t ask the cast. Don’t even ask creators Ross and Matt Duffer, because they haven’t even worked out who The American could be yet.

David Harbour – who recently confirmed his relationship with Lily Allen in the romance we didn’t see coming but are absolutely living for – recently called the showrunners up during an appearance on Late Night With Seth Meyers, and asked WTF is going on with Hopper.

Their answer? ‘I mean, we’re still figuring it out, David.’

Great.

However, we have seen photos from the set of Stranger Things four and if these pictures can only confirm Hopper’s safety, surely?

Stranger Things seasons one to three are available to stream on Netflix.
